what: National Road Safety Observatory (ONSV) Style for ggplot2 Graphics
title: National Road Safety Observatory (ONSV) Style for ggplot2 Graphics
text: goal onsvplot provide ggplot theme color elements help create graphics style National Observatory Road Safety.

title: National Road Safety Observatory (ONSV) Style for ggplot2 Graphics
text: package provides two main functions palette colors: theme_onsv(): Apply ONSV theme ggplot object; scale_discrete_onsv(): Apply ONSV color palette ggplot object; onsv_palette: data object provides full palette colors, including hex codes.

title: National Road Safety Observatory (ONSV) Style for ggplot2 Graphics
text: can install development version onsvplot like : CRAN version:

title: National Road Safety Observatory (ONSV) Style for ggplot2 Graphics
text: basic example shows apply functions included package. First, basic ggplot graphics:  , apply theme_onsv() change theme plot scale_discrete_onsv() change colors:  one color necessary plot, possible use one colors included onsv_palette object; applying directly color fill geom:
code: library(onsvplot) library(ggplot2)  plot1 <-    ggplot(data = iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   geom_point()  plot1 theme_set(theme_onsv())  plot1 + scale_discrete_onsv() str(onsv_palette) #> List of 12 #>  $ blue       : chr "#00496d" #>  $ yellow     : chr "#f7951d" #>  $ red        : chr "#d51f29" #>  $ green      : chr "#1fa149" #>  $ pink       : chr "#ec0d6b" #>  $ orange     : chr "#f05f22" #>  $ lightblue  : chr "#99B6C5" #>  $ lightyellow: chr "#FCD5A5" #>  $ lightred   : chr "#EEA5A9" #>  $ lightgreen : chr "#A5D9B6" #>  $ lightpink  : chr "#F79EC4" #>  $ lightorange: chr "#F9BFA7" ggplot(data = iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width)) +   geom_point(color = onsv_palette$yellow)

title: National Road Safety Observatory (ONSV) Style for ggplot2 Graphics
text: want cite package, can cite :
code: #> To cite package 'onsvplot' in publications use: #>  #>   Santos PAB (2023). _onsvplot: National Road Safety Observatory (ONSV) #>   Style for 'ggplot2' Graphics_. #>   https://github.com/pabsantos/onsvplot/, #>   https://pabsantos.github.io/onsvplot/. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {onsvplot: National Road Safety Observatory (ONSV) Style for 'ggplot2' Graphics}, #>     author = {Pedro Augusto Borges Santos}, #>     year = {2023}, #>     note = {https://github.com/pabsantos/onsvplot/, https://pabsantos.github.io/onsvplot/}, #>   }

Apply ONSV color scale to ggplot object — scale_discrete_onsv

title: Apply ONSV color scale to ggplot object — scale_discrete_onsv
text: custom scale object ggplot objects

title: Apply ONSV color scale to ggplot object — scale_discrete_onsv
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(data = iris, aes(x = Sepal.Width, y = Sepal.Length, color = Species)) +   geom_point() +   theme_onsv() +   scale_discrete_onsv()

title: onsvplot 0.4.1
text: Change values legend.key.size legend.text theme_onsv() (#13 #14)

title: onsvplot 0.4.0
text: Add new arguments scale_discrete_onsv: .... Now possible pass arguments lower level ggplot2 functions, scale_discrete_manual discrete_scale.

title: onsvplot 0.3.2
text: CRAN release: 2023-09-05 Released CRAN: now possible install using install.packages("onsvplot").

title: onsvplot 0.2.2
text: Add new parameter theme_onsv() (#7): Now possible change basesize font used plot

title: onsvplot 0.2.1
text: Add two new parameters theme_onsv() (#3): plot.title.position = "plot" plot.caption.position = "plot". Add bottom margin title element.

title: onsvplot 0.2.0
text: Updates package name onsvplot. obsplot package already exists, therefore necessary change previous name. (#4) Also, version changes function object names: theme_obs() theme_onsv() scale_discrete_obs() scale_discrete_onsv() obs_palette onsv_palette
